ser321.media

Class MediaLibraryGui

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • ser321.media.MediaLibraryGui
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class MediaLibraryGui
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Copyright 2015 Tim Lindquist, Right to Use: Students in ASU Software Engineering course Ser321 are granted the right to use this and dependent classes in their compiled (bytecode) format only for the purposes of solving programming assignments in Ser321. This software uses software that is copyrighted by Oracle as documented elsewhere in these javadocs. The class ser321.media.MediaControl has the following copyright Copyright (c) 2008, 2012 Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved. Use is subject to license terms. See javadocs for further information. Purpose: Window class for students in Ser321 to develop their media browser and player. This class uses the JavaFX framework for media playback, and creates playback controls using an open source class MediaLibraryGui creates a window with a File and Media menus, whose contained menu items are exposed through protected fields of MediaLibraryGui. The window is a split pane with scroll pane on each side. The left scroll pane has a tree, which should be used to display the media library structure -- based on media type (music or video). The right pane has the JTextField's and JComboBox for viewing and entering media descriptions. MediaLibraryGui contains protected definitions for its members, which need to be accessed by the controller class. The protected fields can be accessed by an extending class (MediaLibraryApp) to gain access to the GUI components. Ser321 Principles of Distributed Software Systems see http://pooh.poly.asu.edu/Ser321
    Version:
    July 2015
    Author:
    Tim Lindquist (Tim.Linquist@asu.edu), ASU Polytechnic, Engineering
    See Also:

      • tree

        protected javax.swing.JTree tree
        tree is the javax.swing.JTree displayed in the left pane of the window.

      • menuNames

        protected java.lang.String[] menuNames
        String array of menu names The array's value is: {"File","Media"}

      • fileMenuNames

        protected java.lang.String[] fileMenuNames
        Array of strings naming the action commands for File menu. The array's value is: {"Save","Restore","Tree Refresh","Exit"}.

      • mediaMenuNames

        protected java.lang.String[] mediaMenuNames
        Array of strings naming the action commands for Media menu. The array's value is: {"Add","Remove","Play"}.

      • userMenuItems

        protected javax.swing.JMenuItem[][] userMenuItems
        The menu items. Each entry in the array is a javax.swing.JMenuItem. userMenuItems is an array of arrays. Each sub array contains the JMenuItem objects for the respective menus (File and Media). Note the order in this array matches the order in the menuNames arrays.

      • menuItemNames

        protected java.lang.String[][] menuItemNames
        The menu item names. menuItemNames is an array of arrays. Note the order in this array matches the order in menu names array.

    • Method Detail

      • buildInitialTree

        protected void buildInitialTree(javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode root,
                                java.lang.String base)
        create and initialize nodes in the JTree of the left pane. buildInitialTree is called by MediaLibraryGui to initialize the JTree. Classes that extend MediaLibraryGui should override this method to provide initialization actions specific to the extended class. The default functionality is to set base as the label of root.
        Parameters:
        root - Is the root node of the tree to be initialized.
        base - Is the label of the root node of the tree.

      • playMedia

        public void playMedia(java.lang.String path,
                      java.lang.String title)
        public method to play a media file. The playMedia method causes a new thread to be created to play the media. Playing a media file checks to see whether an existing playback is already active and if so, it disposes of the current playing media. The thread is an object of an internal class.
        Parameters:
        path - Is the url file path to the media file: for example:

        file:///home/lindquis/Assign6/Music/comemonday.mp3

        Do not use a string literal for the path. Build the url as is shown in the Sample by obtaining the value of the System property user.dir. That way your solution will work no matter where on your filesystem you place your solution directory.

        title - Is the title of the media file designated by path.
